database

Class TransferData

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.TransferData

  • public class TransferData
extends java.lang.Object
    Exports data of Database's tables to Excel Sheets, which can be imported at another time.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Theodosis Tsaklanos

    • Field Detail

      • uniqueKeyIdentifier

        protected final java.lang.String uniqueKeyIdentifier
        A specific key used to mark every Excel file created by this database. It is printed on the first line of an Excel file when a Table is being exported and is afterwards used to identify if a Table being imported was created by this database.
        Excel files that do not bear this mark cannot be imported.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • fileName

        private java.lang.String fileName

      • in

        private java.io.BufferedReader in

      • jfc

        private javax.swing.JFileChooser jfc

      • importFile

        protected java.io.File importFile(javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Allows the user to choose a .xls file that contains a table's data from a specific disk, directory and/or folder.
        Parameters:
        frame - - the JFrame where the FileChooser will be displayed.

      • checkForUniqueKeyIdentifier

        protected boolean checkForUniqueKeyIdentifier(java.io.File checkFile)
        Reads only the first line of the .xlsx and checks if the key exists or not. uniqueKeyIdentifier
        Parameters:
        checkFile - - the file that is going to be searched
        Returns:
        true if the key exists or false if it does not exist.

      • startReadingFile

        protected void startReadingFile(java.io.File readFile,
                                java.lang.String tableName)
        Imports an .xls file in order to fill the database.

        Note: The .xls file must contain the key identifier uniqueKeyIdentifier.
        Parameters:
        readFile - - the file that is going to be read.
        tableName - - the name of the table that is going to be created.

      • exportFile

        protected java.io.File exportFile(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                                  database.Table table)
        Allows the user to save a .xls file that contains a table's data to a preferred destination in their computer.
        Parameters:
        frame - - the JFrame where the FileChooser will be displayed.
        table - - the table to be exported

      • startWritingFile

        protected void startWritingFile(database.Table table,
                                java.io.File destination)
        Writes the data of a Table to the selected .xls file.
        Parameters:
        table - - the data to be written.
        destination - - the .xls file where the data are going to be written in.
